label: 公出挙
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: official mandatory rice loans originally meant to encourage agriculture but which came in the eighth century to be used to support provincial administration. Rice seed stored by provincial authorities was distributed to all cultivators as loans in the spring and recollected with interest varying from thirty to fifty per cent in the fall.
